title: Getting Started with wixarikaRt
text: wixarikaRt provides color palettes inspired Wixarika (Huichol) people Indigenous peoples Mexico. palettes bring vibrant colors deep symbolism Indigenous art data visualizations.

title: Getting Started with wixarikaRt
code: # Get a palette colors <- wixarika_pal("tatewari_warm") colors #> [1] "#FBF8F0" "#E68B9B" "#C73E42" "#D84F35" "#E7A45D" "#F0C542"  # Use in base R barplot(1:6, col = colors, main = "Tatewari Warm")

title: Getting Started with wixarikaRt
code: ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.8) +   scale_color_wixarika("muvieri_vivid") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "Iris Dataset with Muvieri Vivid Palette") ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_raster() +   scale_fill_wixarika("hikuri_seq", discrete = FALSE) +   theme_minimal() +   labs(title = "Old Faithful with Hikuri Sequential Palette")

title: Getting Started with wixarikaRt
text: palette inspired sacred elements Wixarika culture: Tatewari (Grandfather Fire): Warm reds golds Kauyumari (Deer Spirit): Forest greens sky blues Hikuri (Sacred Peyote): Deep teals bright yellows Nierika (Spiritual Portal): Balanced earth sky tones
code: wixarika_pal_info("tatewari_warm") #>  #> tatewari_warm #>   Name: Tatewari Warm #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Inspired by Grandfather Fire, with warm reds, oranges, and golds

what: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: wixarikaRt provides collection color palettes inspired art, culture, symbolism Wixarika (Huichol) people Indigenous peoples Mexico.

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: can install development version wixarikaRt GitHub:

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
code: library(wixarikaRt)  # List all available palettes wixarika_pal_names()  # Show all palettes wixarika_show_all()  # Get a specific palette colors <- wixarika_pal("tatewari_warm")  # Use with ggplot2 library(ggplot2) ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_wixarika("muvieri_vivid")

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: package includes 18 carefully crafted palettes:

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: tatewari_warm - Warm tones inspired Grandfather Fire kauyumari_forestsky - Forest greens sky blues tayau_dawn - Dawn colors Father Sun nakawe_earthnight - Earth ocean tones hikuri_teal - Sacred peyote colors hikuri_seq - Smooth teal yellow gradient kiekari_sky_seq - Sky progression tatewari_embers_seq - Fire embers

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: nierika_diverging - Portal worlds haramara_tatewari - Ocean fire tatewari_spectrum - Full fire spectrum tsikuri_div_cb - Colorblind-friendly diverging

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: tsikuri_balance - Balanced ceremonial colors muvieri_vivid - Vivid ceremonial arrows mapa_lenguas - Historical language map colors tsikuri_q_cb - Colorblind-friendly qualitative

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: hikuri_teal_extended - Extended peyote colors mapa_lenguas_named - Named language families

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: Wixarika (Huichol) people indigenous group Sierra Madre Occidental Mexico, known vibrant yarn paintings, beadwork, deep spiritual traditions.

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico

title: wixarikaRt • Color Palettes Inspired by Indigenous Peoples of Mexico
text: package created deep respect Wixarika people Indigenous peoples Mexico.

what: Wixarika Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_wixarika
title: Wixarika Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_wixarika
text: Wixarika Color Scales ggplot2

title: Wixarika Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_wixarika
code: scale_color_wixarika(name, discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)  scale_colour_wixarika(name, discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)  scale_fill_wixarika(name, discrete = TRUE, reverse = FALSE, ...)

title: Wixarika Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_wixarika
text: name Name palette discrete Logical. Use discrete (TRUE) continuous (FALSE) scale reverse Logical. Reverse palette? ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2 scale functions

title: Wixarika Color Scales for ggplot2 — scale_color_wixarika
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(ggplot2)  # Discrete color scale ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_wixarika("muvieri_vivid")  # Continuous fill scale ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_wixarika("hikuri_seq", discrete = FALSE) } # }

title: Get a Wixarika Palette — wixarika_pal
text: Get Wixarika Palette

title: Get a Wixarika Palette — wixarika_pal
code: wixarika_pal(name, n = NULL, type = "discrete", reverse = FALSE)

title: Get a Wixarika Palette — wixarika_pal
text: name Name palette. Use wixarika_pal_names() see available palettes. n Number colors return. NULL, returns colors palette. type Type palette: "discrete" "continuous" reverse Logical. palette reversed?

title: Get a Wixarika Palette — wixarika_pal
text: character vector hex color codes

title: Get a Wixarika Palette — wixarika_pal
code: # Get a complete palette wixarika_pal("tatewari_warm") #> [1] "#FBF8F0" "#E68B9B" "#C73E42" "#D84F35" "#E7A45D" "#F0C542"  # Get 3 colors from a palette wixarika_pal("kauyumari_forestsky", n = 3) #> [1] "#5A8A6B" "#6B9C85" "#3D7C96"  # Reverse a palette wixarika_pal("tayau_dawn", reverse = TRUE) #> [1] "#2E3E58" "#4B5E91" "#8C3B6C" "#D84F35" "#F2B43C" "#FDF4E1"

title: Print Wixarika Palette Information — wixarika_pal_info
text: Print Wixarika Palette Information

title: Print Wixarika Palette Information — wixarika_pal_info
text: name Name palette. NULL, shows palettes.

title: Print Wixarika Palette Information — wixarika_pal_info
text: Invisibly returns palette information

title: Print Wixarika Palette Information — wixarika_pal_info
code: # Show all palette information wixarika_pal_info() #>  #> tatewari_warm #>   Name: Tatewari Warm #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Inspired by Grandfather Fire, with warm reds, oranges, and golds #>  #> kauyumari_forestsky #>   Name: Kauyumari Forest & Sky #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Sacred deer spirit, forest greens and sky blues #>  #> tayau_dawn #>   Name: Tayau Dawn #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Father Sun at dawn, warm to cool progression #>  #> nakawe_earthnight #>   Name: Nakawe Earth & Night #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Grandmother Earth and ocean, earthy tones to deep sea #>  #> tsikuri_balance #>   Name: Tsikuri Balance #>   Type: qualitative #>   Description: Ceremonial gourd bowls, balanced warm and cool tones #>  #> tatewari_spectrum #>   Name: Tatewari Spectrum #>   Type: diverging #>   Description: Full fire spectrum from red to blue flames #>  #> nierika_diverging #>   Name: Nierika Diverging #>   Type: diverging #>   Description: Portal between worlds, cool to neutral to warm #>  #> muvieri_vivid #>   Name: Muvieri Vivid #>   Type: qualitative #>   Description: Ceremonial arrows, vivid contrasting colors #>  #> tsikuri_q_cb #>   Name: Tsikuri Qualitative (CB) #>   Type: qualitative #>   Description: Colorblind-friendly qualitative palette #>   Colorblind Safe: TRUE #>  #> nakawe_seq_cb #>   Name: Nakawe Sequential (CB) #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Colorblind-friendly earth tones #>   Colorblind Safe: TRUE #>  #> tsikuri_div_cb #>   Name: Tsikuri Diverging (CB) #>   Type: diverging #>   Description: Colorblind-friendly diverging palette #>   Colorblind Safe: TRUE #>  #> hikuri_teal #>   Name: Hikuri Teal #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Sacred peyote, deep teal to bright yellow #>  #> hikuri_teal_extended #>   Name: Hikuri Teal Extended #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Extended version with more color steps #>  #> hikuri_seq #>   Name: Hikuri Sequential #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Smooth sequential from deep teal through turquoise to yellow #>  #> haramara_tatewari #>   Name: Haramara Tatewari #>   Type: diverging #>   Description: Ocean to fire, teal through cream to gold #>  #> kiekari_sky_seq #>   Name: Kiekari Sky #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Night sky to day sky progression #>  #> tatewari_embers_seq #>   Name: Tatewari Embers #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Fire embers, deep reds through bright yellows #>  #> mapa_lenguas #>   Name: Mapa de Lenguas #>   Type: qualitative #>   Description: Pre-Hispanic indigenous languages distribution map colors #>  #> mapa_lenguas_named #>   Name: Mapa de Lenguas (Named) #>   Type: qualitative #>   Description: Named language family colors from historical map  # Show specific palette information wixarika_pal_info("tatewari_warm") #>  #> tatewari_warm #>   Name: Tatewari Warm #>   Type: sequential #>   Description: Inspired by Grandfather Fire, with warm reds, oranges, and golds

title: List Available Wixarika Palettes — wixarika_pal_names

title: WixarikaRt Color Palettes — wixarika_palettes
text: collection color palettes inspired art culture Wixarika (Huichol) people Indigenous peoples Mexico.

title: WixarikaRt Color Palettes — wixarika_palettes
text: list color palettes object class list length 19.

title: WixarikaRt Color Palettes — wixarika_palettes
text: palettes inspired : Tatewari: Grandfather fire, sacred Wixarika people Kauyumari: sacred deer spirit Tayau: Father Sun Nakawe: Grandmother Earth ocean Tsikuri: Traditional ceremonial gourd bowls Nierika: Portal spirit world Muvieri: Arrows ceremonial objects Hikuri: Sacred peyote Haramara: Pacific Ocean Kiekari: Sky celestial elements Mapa Lenguas: Pre-Hispanic indigenous languages distribution map

title: WixarikaRt Color Palettes — wixarika_palettes
code: # View available palettes names(wixarika_palettes) #>  [1] "tatewari_warm"        "kauyumari_forestsky"  "tayau_dawn"           #>  [4] "nakawe_earthnight"    "tsikuri_balance"      "tatewari_spectrum"    #>  [7] "nierika_diverging"    "muvieri_vivid"        "tsikuri_q_cb"         #> [10] "nakawe_seq_cb"        "tsikuri_div_cb"       "hikuri_teal"          #> [13] "hikuri_teal_extended" "hikuri_seq"           "haramara_tatewari"    #> [16] "kiekari_sky_seq"      "tatewari_embers_seq"  "mapa_lenguas"         #> [19] "mapa_lenguas_named"    # Access a specific palette wixarika_palettes$tatewari_warm #> [1] "#FBF8F0" "#E68B9B" "#C73E42" "#D84F35" "#E7A45D" "#F0C542"

text: NULL (displays plot)

title: Display a Wixarika Palette — wixarika_show_pal
code: # Display a palette wixarika_show_pal("tatewari_warm")   # Display with more colors (interpolated) wixarika_show_pal("kauyumari_forestsky", n = 20)
